question: 粗い
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>coarse</kanji>? <vocabulary>Coarse</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>rough</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn this reading yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

The most <vocabulary>coarse</vocabulary> thing you can think of is <reading>a ro</reading>ck (<ja>あら</ja>). You rubbed it on your face and it was really <vocabulary>rough</vocabulary> and kinda painful. You probably shouldn't be rubbing a rock on your face, actually.
